summary: Normally, if federal contractors can't work, agencies don't pay them. But section 3610 of the CARES Act allows agencies, at their discretion, to reimburse contractors for the cost of paid leave during the COVID-19 pandemic. The Act was passed in March 2020. Between then and early July, all the agencies we reviewed issued some form of guidance to implement section 3610. In July, the Office...
title: COVID-19 Contracting: Observations on Contractor Paid Leave Reimbursement Guidance and Use
